detail.title: Gesture Details
detail.selectHint: Select a gesture on the left to see detailed information.

caution.title: Cautions
items: Recognition may be reduced in low light.
Keep your hands within the camera frame.
Gestures work best when performed slowly and with clear motion.
Two-hand gestures require both hands to be visible on screen at the same time.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Show your palm facing the camera
Move slowly near the center of the frame
tips: If your hand is too close, it may become shaky.
Move smoothly using your whole arm for stability.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the cursor may jump or stop.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index finger clearly
Hold longer to drag while moving (drag)
tips: A small pinch may be detected weakly.
For dragging, keep the pinch and move slowly.
pitfalls: If short/long is confusing, try holding for about 0.5 seconds instead of releasing too quickly.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle fingers to make a V shape
Keep your palm facing the camera
tips: A wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap or the angle is narrow, recognition may be unstable.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM + FIST
gestures.trigger: One hand OPEN_PALM + the other hand FIST
howTo: Keep both hands visible within the frame
Move your hand up/down to scroll
tips: While scrolling, small repeated movements work best.
pitfalls: If one hand disappears from the frame, scrolling may stop.

gestures.name: FIST (HOLD)
howTo: Hold a fist for a set duration
After toggling, release your hand.
pitfalls: If you hold a fist often for a long time, it may toggle unintentionally.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Make a fist once to toggle
After toggling, release your hand.
tips: Toggles can misfire easilyâ€”perform it slowly and only once.
pitfalls: If repeated fists are detected, it may toggle repeatedly.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm and move
If the line shakes, move more slowly.
tips: In Draw mode, moving the cursor is the pen position.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the position may jump.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch to pen down (draw)
Release to pen up (stop)
tips: If the line breaks, try holding the PINCH more clearly.
pitfalls: If the PINCH is weak, pen-down may be unstable.

gestures.name: TWO OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open both hands and keep them within the frame
Hold briefly and then perform
tips: Both hands must be recognized at the same time.
pitfalls: If one hand enters late, recognition may fail.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Show your palm facing the camera
Move slowly near the center of the frame
tips: If your hand is too close, it may become shaky.
Move smoothly using your whole arm for stability.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the cursor may jump or stop.

gestures.name: PINCH_INDEX
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index finger together
Perform once briefly
tips: If the finger gap is too small or unclear, recognition may be weak.
pitfalls: Holding too long may be confused with other gestures (two-hand hold).

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Make a fist once briefly
tips: For continuous paging, repeat slowly with a steady rhythm.
pitfalls: Repeating too fast may cause unintended repeated inputs.

gestures.name: V_SIGN
howTo: Spread your index and middle fingers to make a V shape
Perform once briefly
tips: A wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap or the angle is narrow, recognition may be unstable.

gestures.name: TWO FIST (HOLD)
howTo: Make fists with both hands at the same time
Hold for a set duration, then release
tips: To prevent misfires, a 'hold' is required.
pitfalls: If only one hand becomes a fist or timing is off, recognition may fail.

gestures.name: TWO PINCH_INDEX (HOLD)
howTo: Pinch with both hands (thumb + index)
Hold for a set duration, then release
tips: Useful to return after opening links/videos.
pitfalls: If only one hand pinches, recognition may fail.
